title: Surface plasmon excitation in semitransparent inverted polymer photovoltaic devices and their applications as label-free optical sensors
title_cn: 半透明倒置聚合物光伏器件中的表面等离激元激发及其作为无标签光学传感器的应用
abstract: Herein, we report on surface plasmon (SP)-sensitive semitransparent inverted polymer photovoltaic (PV) devices that are based on multilayered material systems consisting of poly(3-hexylthiophene): fullerene-derivative bulk-heterojunction PV layers and thin gold or silver anodes. We demonstrate that these PV devices allow the simultaneous generation of both electrical power and SPs on their anodes for photoexcitation just above the optical absorption edge of the PV layers, resulting not only in attenuated total reflection, but also in attenuated photocurrent generation (APG) under the SP resonance (SPR) condition. Moreover, we also confirm that the biomolecular interaction of biotin–streptavidin on the PV devices can be precisely detected via apparent SPR angle shifts in the APG spectra, even without the need for complex attenuated total reflection configurations. We highlight our view that APG measurements made using these PV devices show great potential for the development of future generations of compact and highly sensitive SPR-based optical sensors.
abstract_cn: 此处，我们报告了基于等离子（SP）敏感的半透明倒置聚合物光伏（PV）器件，该器件基于由聚（3-己基噻吩）组成的多层材料系统：富勒烯衍生物本体-异质结PV层和薄金或银阳极。我们证明了这些PV器件允许在阳极上同时产生电能和SP，以在PV层的光吸收边缘上方进行光激发，不仅导致衰减的全反射，而且导致在以下条件下衰减的光电流生成（APG） SP共振（SPR）条件。此外，我们还证实，即使不需要复杂的衰减全反射配置，也可以通过APG光谱中的明显SPR角偏移来精确检测生物素链霉亲和素在PV设备上的生物分子相互作用。我们强调我们的观点，即使用这些PV器件进行的APG测量显示出了开发下一代紧凑型和高度灵敏的基于SPR的光学传感器的巨大潜力。

title: DNA-assembled bimetallic plasmonic nanosensors
title_cn: DNA组装的双金属等离子体纳米传感器
abstract: Plasmonic hybrid nanomaterials are highly desirable in advanced sensing applications. Different components in these materials undertake distinct roles and work collectively. One material component may act as an efficient light concentrator and optical probe, whereas another provides specific chemical or biological functionality. In this work, we present DNA-assembled bimetallic plasmonic nanostructures and demonstrate their application for the all-optical detection of hydrogen. Gold (Au) nanorods are functionalized with DNA strands, which serve both as linkers and seeding sites for the growth of palladium (Pd) nanocrystals and facilitate reliable positioning of Pd satellites around an Au nanorod at an ultrashort spacing in the nanometer range. Dark-field scattering spectra of single Au–DNA–Pd nanorods were recorded during controlled cycles of hydrogen gas exposure, and an unambiguous concentration-dependent optical response was observed. Our method enables, for the first time, the all-optical detection of hydrogen-induced phase-change processes in sub-5-nm Pd nanocrystals at the single-antenna level. By substituting the Pd satellites with other functional materials, our sensor platform can be extended to plasmonic sensing of a multitude of chemical and biological reagents, both in liquid and gaseous phases.
abstract_cn: 在先进的传感应用中，高度理想的是压电混合纳米材料。这些材料中的不同组成部分承担着不同的角色并共同工作。一种材料成分可以充当高效的聚光器和光学探针，而另一种则提供特定的化学或生物学功能。在这项工作中，我们提出了DNA组装的双金属等离子体纳米结构，并展示了它们在氢的全光学检测中的应用。金（Au）纳米棒通过DNA链进行功能化，该DNA链既是钯（Pd）纳米晶体生长的连接子又是种子播种位点，并有助于在纳米范围内以超短间距将Pd卫星可靠地定位在Au纳米棒周围。在受控的氢气暴露循环中，记录了单个Au＆＃8211; DNA＆＃8211; Pd纳米棒的暗场散射光谱，并观察到了明确的浓度依赖性光学响应。我们的方法首次实现了在单天线级对5纳米以下Pd纳米晶体中氢诱导的相变过程进行全光学检测。通过将Pd卫星替换为其他功能材料，我们的传感器平台可以扩展为对液相和气相中多种化学和生物试剂进行等离子体检测。</ p>
